channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous sharp edges, 23rd February
item.description:
Someone has dropped and smashed up a wash basin and dumped outside 57 Marlings park avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Marlings Park Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: South Croxted Road SE21 streetlight column ID n, 23rd February
item.description:
Umber 30 (outside house number 213) not lighting tonight. This column is on Lambeth side but it is your responsibility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Croxted Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage spilling, 23rd February
item.description:
There are severe drainage issues which after several weeks have not been fixed. Raw sewage is sitting in the driveway not draining. No attempt to clear the blockage has been made and it poses a serious health risk to young families living nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emba Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trashing in public space, 23rd February
item.description:
The trashs had been accumulated at random location inside Block 3 elevator, 1 Churchyard Row building.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Churchyard Row, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Light is off during night time, 23rd February
item.description:
This street light appears broken. The adjacent street light on the opposite side of the road (in the direction of Brampton Road) also appears to be broken

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlborough Road, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Millfields road from Millfields Cafe/Park all the way up Every 5 meters approx a different pile of poo, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a different pile of dog foul every 5 meters all the way up on almost every tree on Millfields road up from the Millfields Cafe in E5 . Its unacceptable . Children walking, running and scooting from home to Millfields Community school and Park .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large cracks down centre of road, 23rd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Murchison Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London

item.title: Large pothole middle of road, 23rd February
item.description:
Large pothole in the middle of the road 6 x 18 inches 4 inches deep .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Murchison Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal car repairs, 23rd February
item.description:
The resident on 30 Maple Road is running an illegal car business on the public highroad. Checking companies house no official business is registered.. so clearly undeclared earnings !! We have welding, blocked pavement wires to step over.. serious breaches if health and safety all days of the week including days when children are attempted to attend the school less than 100 meters away. dangerous hot works are also being untaken. This needs to stop. How many cars is he parking on the public road this is not a gypsy site.Bromley council needs to take responsible and shut this down and move these dangerously brick resting vehicles off Maple Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31-37, Maple Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish on side of road, 23rd February
item.description:
Originally was a fridge left on the corner of this road weeks ago. Now this is encouraging more flytipping and keeps growing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northfield Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Uncollected rubbish 2nd report . Rats and foxes running around . Been there months . The school takes no responsibility, 23rd February
item.description:
I reported this serious problem months ago and you sent a residential person to look at it . He couldn’t do anything because it’s a school rubbish bin next to a residential block . It’s disgusting and the school needs to take responsibility for this area after it’s been cleared up . Please sort this out before a child is bitten by a rat or a fox . Both are seen around the rubbish . Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lockyer Estate, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes all the way from Christchurch road in sidcup down to longlands road. Really big and damaging cars, 23rd February
item.description:
There are getting more and more potholes down the stretch of main road from Christchurch road in sidcup to the junction of longlands road. The worst one is outside the fire station in the middle of the road. Huge and cannot see very well in the dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 167, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 seater sofa & radiator cover dumped, 23rd February
item.description:
Regular spot for fly tipping. Has been going on for years. Warning sign about issue from council is completely ineffective. Temporary CCTV and prosecution of guilty parties would put an end to this issue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Median Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 cars untaxed and have been left unattended, 23rd February
item.description:
2 vehicles have been left for a long amount of time, and are untaxed. Neither belong to anyone in the street or surrounding roads and haven’t moved for weeks. Are taking up spaces for residents of the road. Staple close as you drive up they are on the right hand side. Silver Vauxhall corsa and a brown Dacia Logan

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Staple Close, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Please empty

item.title: Blocked drain, 23rd February
item.description:
There’s a blocked drain hole that leads to road flooding whenever it rains - which has been the case for the last two months. The flooding is a danger for lack of visibility of potholes and increased risk for the tarmac and road surface as well as cars adherence to the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherborne Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
